p: The indicators evaluated only partially related to definitions utilized in spatial statistics (SS) and Network Theory (NT). There were differences between or among: 1) ‘spatial’ and ‘geographic’, 2) ‘mobility’ and ‘connectivity’, 3) ‘nodes’ (as defined in NT) and epidemic nodes, 4) ‘links’ (node degrees, as defined in NT) and infective links, 5) ‘clusters’ (as defined in SS and NT) and disease clusters, and 6) classes of primary cases, networks, and epidemic nodes.
